justification: The package contains only 2 classes and a total of 164 LOC, which is small in terms of both class count and overall size. The largest class (SequenceSearchOperation) is 116 LOC with WMC=35 indicating some concentrated complexity, but this single moderately complex class does not make the package excessively large. Dependencies are limited (Ce=2, Ca=1). Given the low number of classes and modest total LOC, there is insufficient evidence to consider this package a God Component.

The package contains only 2 classes and 259 total LOC, with individual class sizes of 154 LOC and 105 LOC. Method counts (12 and 11) and WMC values (15 each) indicate moderate per-class complexity, not extreme. Coupling metrics are low (Ca=0, Ce=4) and fan-in/fan-out are 0. Given the small number of classes, modest total LOC, and limited coupling, there is insufficient evidence to consider this package an excessively large (God) component.

The package contains only 2 classes and 140 LOC (IStageClosedListener: 3 LOC; StageManager: 137 LOC). Coupling metrics (Ce=3, Ca=2) are also not extreme. Therefore the package does not meet the contextual criteria for a God Component.

The package contains only 2 classes and 259 LOC overall, so it is not excessively large by package-class-count. Therefore, using the provided contextual data, the package does not qualify as a God Component even if one class within it is relatively large.

The package contains 4 classes and 246 LOC overall, which is not excessively large for a package. The package org.adoptopenjdk.jitwatch.util contains 17 classes and 1,880 LOC with a clear concentration of size and responsibility in a few classes. ParseUtil alone is 753 LOC with 46 methods and WMC 200, and StringUtil is 283 LOC with 29 methods and WMC 72; those two classes account for ~1,036 LOC (>50% of the package LOC). Additional mid‑sized classes (FileUtil 132 LOC, UserInterfaceUtil 144 LOC) further increase the package's bulk. The package also has high afferent coupling (Ca = 40), meaning many parts of the system depend on it, amplifying the impact of its size. Taken together — large total LOC, heavy concentration in very large classes (high method counts and complexity), and many dependents — this indicates an excessively large component (God Component).

The package has 5 classes and 424 LOC but one class, AbstractLogParser, contains 374 LOC (~88% of package LOC), 35 methods (nom), and a very high WMC (80). This concentration of size and complexity in a single class (many methods, high complexity and many dependencies) indicates the component is doing too much and exhibits God Component characteristics.

The package contains 104 classes and 42,742 LOC, indicating a very large component by class count and size. Critically, a single class, CodeCacheBuster, has 20,010 LOC and 5,001 methods (WMC 5,002), which alone comprises roughly 47% of the package LOC and an extreme method count. This pronounced concentration of code and the high overall class count justify detecting a God Component: the component is excessively large both in total LOC and because it contains at least one overwhelmingly large class.
